item.description:
Another chance to check out the Cultural Survival Bazaar. The last time I attended, the items I purchased supported an Ugandan school, Maasai beadworkers, Zimbabwean female musicians, Nipmuc (Native American tribe from Worcester County) artists, Bolivian women cooperatives and many others.

This is an opportunity for Indigenous artists, their representatives, and fair trade companies from around the world to sell their work directly to the American public.

Post a comment with the time you'll be there, then you can work out meet up details with each other. Entertainment..music, story telling, crafts demonstrations and more.

You will also have many food options from food carts, food trucks, fast food and restaurants.

The streets which surround Copley Square are Boylston, Clarendon, St.James and Dartmouth.

The closest subway stations are Copley on the Green line and Back Bay on the Orange line.
item.how_to_find_us: Post comment with time you'll be there and coordinate meeting up with folks who will be there at the same time.

group.name: Breakfast, Brunch, Lunch, & Dinner Meetup Group

item.name: Buy Souvenirs from Distant Lands, Locally
